updates.text:
We apologize for the inconvenience this service disruption may have caused. We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Support by opening a case using https://cloud.google.com/support
(All Times US/Pacific)
**Incident Start:** 25 August 2021 22:53
**Incident End:** 26 August 2021 00:54
**Duration:** 2 hours, 1 minute
**Affected Services and Features:**
- Google Chat
**Description:**
Google Chat experienced elevated errors for users connecting to the service for a duration of 2 hours and 1 minute. From preliminary analysis, the root cause of the issue is due to a rollout that modified how sessions were handled, leading to failed connections.
**Customer Impact:**
- Affected customers were unable to send or receive new messages.
- The Web UI presented the banner "Loading chat..." indefinitely during the incident.
- Up to 35% of Web clients were unable to establish a connection.
- Up to 5% of Android/IOS mobile app clients were unable to establish a connection.

The problem with Google Chat should be resolved for the vast majority of affected users. We will continue to work towards restoring service for the remaining affected users, but no further updates will be added to this dashboard.
Google Chat service has already been restored for some users, and we expect a resolution for all users in the near future. Please note this time frame is an estimate and may change.

external_desc: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Sites. We will provide more information shortly. The affected users are unable to access Google Sites.

updates.text:
We apologize for the inconvenience this service disruption may have caused. We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Support by opening a case using https://cloud.google.com/support
(All Times US/Pacific)
**Incident Start:** 25 August 2021 09:40 US/Pacific
**Incident End:** 25 August 2021 22:00 US/Pacific
**Duration:** 14 hours, 12 minutes
**Affected Services and Features:**
- Google Sites Classic
- Google Sites New
**Description:**
Google Sites Classic and the new Google Sites experienced intermittent elevated 404 errors and/or pages failing to load for a duration of 14 hours and 12 minutes. During the disruption up to 13.7% of users were impacted, the 500’s response rate increased from 0.01% to 0.3%, and the 400’s response rate increased from 6% to 14%. The root cause was identified as a misconfigured cleanup process. Completing a rollback restored the affected sites, and the error rate returned to normal.
**Customer Impact:**
- Users visiting sites.google.com sometimes received a 404 error when they should have been redirected to the new Sites Homescreen.
- Some users received a 404 error when they visited the Classic Sites landing page.
The problem with Google Sites has been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.

Google Sites service has already been restored for some users, and we expect a resolution for all users in the near future. Please note this time frame is an estimate and may change. The affected users are unable to access Google Sites.
The affected users are unabel to access Sites Homepage.

updates.text:
We apologize for the inconvenience this service disruption may have caused. We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Support by opening a case using https://cloud.google.com/support
(All Times US/Pacific)
**Incident Start:** 25 August 2021 11:17
**Incident End:** 25 August 2021 16:07
**Duration:** 4 hours, 50 minutes
**Affected Services and Features:**
- Google Voice
**Description:**
Google Voice experienced elevated call failures for mobile devices and some dedicated VOIP devices for a duration of 4 hours, 50 minutes. From preliminary analysis, the root cause of the issue was a rapid increase in VOIP registration traffic, which overloaded internal components. The issue has been mitigated by increasing capacity of affected internal components.
**Customer Impact:**
- Less than 5% of Google Voice users experienced failures for inbound and outbound calls on mobile and some dedicated VOIP devices.
- Users connecting through the web client would have seen significantly less impact.
The problem with Google Voice has been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.
Google Voice service has already been restored for some users, and we expect a resolution for all users in the near future. Please note this time frame is an estimate and may change.

external_desc: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Voice. We will provide more information shortly. The affected users are able to access Google Voice, but are seeing error messages, high latency, and/or other unexpected behavior.

updates.text:
# SUMMARY
On Friday, 16 July 2021 at 11:44 US/Pacific, Google Admin Console, Google Voice, Google Vault, and Google Endpoint Management experienced elevated error rates for administrative operations for a duration of 2 hours, 31 minutes. The issue was mitigated by 14:15 US/Pacific.
We understand this issue has affected our valued customers and users, and we apologize to those who were affected.
# ROOT CAUSE
Google Admin Console has multiple backend components to facilitate administration of Google Workspace domains. One such component is a job that handles an administrator’s ability to browse and update settings.
An unexpected queries per second (QPS) increase in traffic caused the service responsible for handling admin settings to be overloaded, which led to throttling of requests. The sudden increase was caused by another service responsible for syncing user’s admin role data. Google has an internal load-shedding safety mechanism to appropriately throttle the problematic service; however, in this case, the safety mechanism unintentionally throttled all traffic instead of only the component causing the increased QPS.
# REMEDIATION AND PREVENTION
Google engineers were alerted to the issue on 16 July 2021 at 11:44 US/Pacific and immediately started an investigation. Efforts to scale up the number of servers began at 12:42 to deal with the increase in traffic. Once the nature of the problem was determined, the origin of the increase in QPS was manually throttled, fully mitigating the issue by 14:15.
To prevent recurrence and reduce the impact of similar events, we are taking the following actions:
Repair load-shedding mechanisms to appropriately throttle traffic in order to limit the scope of impact for issues of this type.
Improve internal processes to throttle single clients sending a high number of queries unexpectedly.
# DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF IMPACT
Google Admin Console: Admins experienced intermittent elevated HTTP 500 errors when trying to browse or update settings, including Gmail and client-side encryption settings. Identity sync changes may have been delayed until the incident was resolved.
Google Voice: ​​Admins were unable to access most of the private branch exchange (PBX) features in the Admin Console and experienced elevated latency in processing subscription change events.
Google Endpoint Management: Admins experienced elevated HTTP 500 errors when trying to browse or update security related settings.
Google Vault: Retention and Hold flows experienced elevated errors.
An incident report has been posted here <https://www.google.com/appsstatus/ir/rwi0ddqtn4ewq72.pdf>.

The problem with Google Voice has been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.
This issue affected Administrator ability to browse and update settings, but end users were not affected.

We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Voice. We will provide more information shortly. The affected users are able to access Google Voice, but are seeing error messages, high latency, and/or other unexpected behavior.

The problem with Gmail has been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.
Updating Android System WebView and Google Chrome via Google Play should now resolve the issue for all users.
1. Navigate to Play Store app
2. Search for Android System WebView (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.webview)
3. Select the "Update" option
4. Repeat these steps for Google Chrome (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.android.chrome)
For more information about updating Android apps please see:
https://support.google.com/googleplay/answer/113412
